verses.roman:
udāsīnāś ca dehādāv
ātmārāmā dhṛta-vratāḥ
mayy āveśya manaḥ samyaṅ
mām ante brahma yāsyatha

synonyms: udāsīnāḥ—indifferent; ca—and; deha-ādau—to the body and so on; ātma-ārāmāḥ—self-satisfied; dhṛta—holding firmly; vratāḥ—to your vows; mayi—upon Me; āveśya—concentrating; manaḥ—the mind; samyak—completely; mām—to Me; ante—in the end; brahma—the Absolute Truth; yāsyatha—you will go.
translation: Be detached from the body and everything connected to it. Remaining self-satisfied, steadfastly keep your vows while concentrating your minds fully on Me. In this way you will ultimately attain Me, the Supreme Absolute Truth.
